document.docAuthor: Hernandes, Fabio A. & Mironov, Sergey V.
document.docTitle: Ciganalichus boasfilhoi Hernandes & Mironov, 2015, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: The feather mites of the hoatzin Opisthocomus hoazin (Müller) (Aves: Opisthocomiformes), with the description of two new genera and six new species (Acari: Analgoidea, Pterolichoidea)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The feather mites of the hoatzin Opisthocomus hoazin (Müller) (Aves: Opisthocomiformes), with the description of two new genera and six new species (Acari: Analgoidea, Pterolichoidea)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material
. Male holotype (DZUNESP-RC # 3146 ),
14 male
and
19 female
paratypes from
Opisthocomus hoazin (Müller, 1776 )
(Opisthocomiformes: Opisthocomidae ),
BRAZIL
, Pará State, Fazenda Fartura,
09° 40 'S
/
50 ° 23 'W
, Santana do Araguaia, 0
8 September 2013
, D.V. Boas-Filho coll. (# 1111 ); other paratypes :
4 males
and
3 females
, same data (# 1110 );
1 male
and
2 females
, same data (# 1112 ).

Depository . Holotype ,
16 male
and
21 female
paratypes at DZUNESP-RC;
3 male
and
3 female
paratypes at ZISP .

Description . MALE ( Figs. 18 , 20 A–D). ( holotype , range for 5 paratypes in parentheses). Gnathosoma almost rectangular, length including palps 54 ( 41–52 ), width at base 48 ( 40–50 ). Idiosoma length from anterior end to lobar apices 352 ( 322–359 ), greatest width at level of humeral shields 175 ( 146–165 ); length of hysterosoma 252 ( 230–248 ). Prodorsal shield: occupying anterior part of prodorsum, with two incisions at level of scapular setae se , length along midline 82 ( 76–82 ), greatest width 83 ( 75–81 ) (
Fig. 18
A). Setae vi filiform, subequal in length to chelicerae, their bases separated by 9 ( 7–9 ). Setae se separated by 66 ( 58–63 ). Setae si spiculiform, 18 ( 19–20 ) long, separated by 46 ( 40–43 ). Setae
c 2
narrowly spiculiform, 17 ( 14–26 ) long, situated in anterior angles of humeral shields. Subhumeral setae
c 3
lanceolate, 26 ( 28–30 ) long. Hysteronotal shield: greatest length from anterior margins to bases of setae
h 3
244 ( 219–241 ), width at anterior margin 125 ( 111–124 ), anterior margin nearly straight, surface with longitudinal striation posterior to setae
e 1
. Hysteronotal gland opening gl situated between levels of setae
d 2
and
e 1
. Supranal concavity present. Opisthosomal lobes scarcely expressed; terminal cleft small, shallowly concave, 10 ( 7–9 ) long. Setae
f 2
and
ps 2
narrowly lanceolate; setae
ps 1
and
h 1
thin, spiculiform; setae
h 1
situated anterior to level of setae
h 3
. Distances between dorsal setae:
c 2 :d 2
97 ( 86–96 ),
d 2 :
e 2
87 ( 77–83 ),
e 2 :h 3
55 ( 42–51 ),
d 1 :d 2
53 ( 36–52 ),
e 1 :
e 2
43 ( 34–45 ),
ps 1 :ps 1
21 ( 16–22 ),
h 3 :h 3
26 ( 23–28 ),
h 2 :h 2
43 ( 38–46 ).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Epimerites I fused into a Y, sternum about 1 / 3 of total length of epimerites. Genital apparatus 20 ( 17–21 ) in length, 12 ( 12–16 ) in width, situated between levels of trochanters III and IV (
Fig. 18
B). Setae
4 b
situated at the same level as setae
3 a
. Setae g and genital papillae situated anterior to genital apparatus apex. Distances between ventral setae:
4 b:g
23 ( 25–36 ),
g: 4a
36 ( 35–48 );
ps 3 :h 3
66 ( 60–67 ). Anal suckers 9 ( 9–10 ) in diameter, without radial striation, corolla without indentations.

Solenidion
σ 1
of genu I slightly shorter than this segment. Setae mG of genua I, II subequal in length. Solenidion φ of tibia IV approximately equal in length to the tarsus. Setae d of tarsi IV button-like, setae e smallspine-like. Length of tarsi:
I 41
( 39–41 ),
II 41
( 38–41 ),
III 50
( 44–52 ),
IV 48
( 45–48 ). Length of solenidia:
σ
1

II 9
( 5–10 ), σ

( 19–21 ), φ

( 74–79 ), φ

( 61–70 ), φ

( 52–58 ), φ

( 43–52 ),

I 15 ( 12–13 ),
ω

ω
3
I 39 ( 30–38 ).

FEMALE ( Figs. 19 , 20 E–F) (range for 5 paratypes ). Gnathosoma, length × width, 61–68 × 44–54 . Idiosoma, length × width, 368–404 × 176–205 , length of hysterosoma 271–294 . Prodorsal shield shaped as in male, 88–92 × 85–88 . Setae vi subequal in length to chelicerae, their bases separated by 8–9 , setae se separated by 65–68 , setae si spiculiform, barbed in apical half, 24–30 long. Setae
c 2
thin spiculiform, 16-19 long, situated in anterior angles of humeral shields. Subhumeral setae
c 3
lanceolate, 29–32 long. Hysteronotal shield: length 262–274 , width 122– 130 , anterior margin nearly straight, surface without ornamentation, posterior margin conical. Setae
e 1
,
e 2
and
h 1
thick, lanceolate, the latter two setae transversely aligned. Supranal concavity absent. Spermatheca and spermaducts as in
Fig. 19
C. Length of dorsal setae:
d
2
12–14 ,
e 1
32
–41,
e
2
30
–38,

1
26–33 . Distances between dorsal setae:

120–127 ,

83–91 ,

Epimerites I as in male. Epigynum horseshoe-shaped, 34–41 long, 33–43 wide. Apodemes of oviporus rudimentary. Setae g situated at the same level of setae
3 a
. Distances between ventral setae:
4 b:g
27–32 ,
g: 4a
9– 11 .

Legs I–III as in male. Solenidion φ of tibia III slightly longer than corresponding tarsus; Solenidion φ of tibia IV about one fifth the corresponding tarsus. Length of tarsi:
I 45
–48,
II 45
–46,
III 57
–61,
IV 66

Etymology .The species is named after David Vilas Boas-Filho (Faculdade Jaguariúna, Campus II, Jaguariúna, SP, Brazil ), who collected most of the material described herein.
